stories.text:
We're a small startup and want to help. We have cloud resources and experience in virtual networking. We're looking for the best way to contribute. Ideas so far are to provide hosting for the following:

- Socks5 proxies - TOR bridges - Signal proxies - WireGuard / VPN servers - Misc tools (file sharing services, compression, etc)

Any other ideas for things that could be materially useful? Keep in mind we don't have a huge budget, just cloud resources and in-house experience.
stories.title: Ask HN: How can tech startups help Ukraine?
Ancient Greek Helmets Tell of a Naval Battle 2,500 Years Ago
Namecheap offers free, anonymous anti-Putin/regime hosting
Ukrainian news site trying to report only verified info on Russian advance

stories.text:
Cloudflare and Let's Encrypt, Josh Aas and Matthew Prince

On behalf of the Ukrainian people who are defending their homeland On behalf of the free democratic world

As you must be aware, there is an ongoing war in Ukraine waged by Russia. The Ukrainians fight their battles not only at the frontline but on the media landscape as well.

Certain Russian websites fuel the flames of war and channel the hatred towards Ukraine; encouraging acts of terrorism and genocide in Ukraine. Disconnecting Russian websites will help bring the Russian propaganda machine to a stop.

As the main companies providing SSL certificates, we hope you choose to contribute to our cause by revoking SSL certificates issued for Russian propaganda websites, as well as stopping issuing new certificates for these companies.

I also ask the CEO of Cloudflare, Inc., Matthew Prince to ban Russia from the Cloudflare services. Disconnecting Russian websites will help shut down the propagandist disinformation flood Russia is feeding to the world. You can help stop the war.

Thank you in advance, we highly appreciate your time and effort.

Stand with Ukraine!
stories.title: Cloudflare and Lets Encrypt ban Russia from your services
